content_markdown:
DataTools Pro simplifies the process of tracking a Salesforce dashboard lifecycle using a simple status field.

- **Production**: Reports and dashboards actively used by business units or individuals.
- **In Progress/Development**: Reports still being built, tested, or validated.
- **Deprecated**: Reports that are no longer used and should be flagged for removal.

**Want to add a custom status for your process?** [Feel free to contact us](/contact)

![](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-42-png.webp)

[Video: Manage Salesforce Dashboard Lifecycle with Status](https://www.youtube.com/embed/-MKLEpGaSGc?feature=oembed)

## Update Status for Salesforce Dashboards and Reports

1. Click on a dashboard or report name to open the Info-Window

![](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-43-png.webp)

2. Select the Analytics Status

## Bulk Edit Status for Salesforce Dashboards and Reports

DataTools Pro allows you to bulk select Dashboards and Reports so you can bulk update status. To complete this task:

1. Select the first report or dashboard for your desired bulk selection

![select Salesforce Dashboard](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-44-png.webp)

2a. **Bulk select additional records 1 by 1:**

Hold the **Ctrl** button on your keyboard and click on the individual records that you would like to bulk edit

![](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-45-1024x389.webp)

2b. **Bulk select records in sequence from first selected**

Hold the **Shift** button on your keyboard and click the last record in sequence that you would like to select. DataTools will auto-select all records in between.

![](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-46-1024x444.webp)

3. Click on the “Edit X Reports” button

4. Select the Status dropdown

![](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/image-47-png.webp)

5. Select 1 Status.

6. Press “Assign Status” to bulk assign the status.

7. Close the window by clicking the close icon or click outside of the popup window.
